fields.summary: Tracer: Build (AS) Tag Editor as angular directive

comments.body: hey [~ashamblin], can you comment here in the ticket some of the issues you've found and solutions for those? And what you've discovered? It's good to have that all written down...
[~ashamblin]: Just a reminder to investigate how we should handle i18n in Angular directives.  Would like to see a proof-of-concept before we consider this tracer complete.   :-)
[~kgill] Can you help me test this?  The last detail before I can consider this spike done is a test of i18n.

[~ashamblin]: Here are the steps to update the translations catalog to test if i18n works...

1. Run ‘make ranslations’ at the repo root to update i18n catalogs.  Note that any invalid XHTML errors will need to be fixed for the catalogs to be updated.  If the command complains of missing libraries (read: Babel or lingua), install them via 'pip install -e .[i18n]' as documented at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/master/README.rst#configuring-i18n
2. Add translation strings to the eucaconsole.po file for the appropriate language at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/tree/master/locale (e.g. for Spanish the file is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/master/locale/es/LC_MESSAGES/eucaconsole.po)
3. Find the appropriate msgid and provide the translated string in msgstr (e.g. if the msgid is "key", the msgstr would be "llave" for Spanish)
4. Set your browser’s preferred language to one we have translations for (e.g. Spanish)
5. Verify the translated string appears in the UI

Hope that helps.  Lemme know if you have questions or run into issues.
[~kgill] As you get a minute, please review latest change.  Adding a route for the directive template was trivial, followed above steps to see Spanish delivered.
[~ashamblin]: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1611 looks great overall -- just a couple of minor comments in the PR.  Nice work!
[~kgill], did you mean for this ticket to still be in review?

[~ashamblin]: Could you submit this to [~jloza] for initial UX review after making the minor corrections I suggested in the PR comments?  Also, we'll need to create an implementation ticket to get the new tag editor in place across our various resources after this tracer is complete.

hi [~ashamblin], looking good so far! Can you do a couple small things, please?
* stack the labels above the fields as shown in the wireframe at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Resource+Tagging instead of embedding them in the fields as they were in the previous implementation
* on the warning that pops up if you done add a tag before saving changes, can you add a scosh of padding above the text block so it's not so close to the close button? Needs a little more whitespace. 
* I can't view scaling group detail  pages in your branch, got waitress error, so I can't see the scaling group tag editor implementation. 
Thanks! Great job so far!

Fixed problem on scaling group detail view in the PR, should be good to merge after CI passes.

UX fixes mentioned above will be done in an implementation ticket.

[~ashamblin]: I restored the managecredentials.css file (since managecredentials.pt requires it), and I think that may have reinstated the merge conflicts.  Could you resolve them w/o nuking the manage credentials CSS file?
Resolved merge conflicts, I believe.  Watching CI.
should this be moved to QA?
[~dkavanagh]: This is a tracer, so the only transitions are "Resolve issue" and "Reject to In Progress".
